intro: Loxocarya albipes, commonly known as the white-flowered spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its flowers are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Loxocarya albipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
